title: FireFox - "CRASHING"
content:
Good day I have been a firefox user for donkey years and recently I have started experience SLUGGISHNESS and the TABS keep on CRASHING.

I have noticed it happens every time with GoDaddy and when I look at the Task running it shows that there are 16+ TABS open and currently I only have 3 tabs open with the settings tab and support tab open

I would appreciate any help as I really do not want to move over to CHROME :(

AS I WAS MAKING THE SCREENSHOT IT THEN SHOWS 10 TABS OPEN
creator: waspit.buzz

title: I have hundreds of duplicate bookmarks
content: My bookmarks keep multiplying. I have hundreds of duplicates I turned off sync everywhere Deleted them and yet every day there are more of them
creator: mmarks1057

title: Restoring profile Data after windows 8.1 crash
content: Good time of day to you! I've just suffered a tragedy? my Windows crashed with all my work related passwords, tabs. I was able to reboot the system, and all the data was mostly intact. So first thing I rushed to reinstall firefox. It works but I don't see any options to restore or reaccess my previos profiles. And I fear that by reinstalling firefox I moght have overwritten the profile directories! Please Help! This is a matter of life and death. Unfortunatelly I haven't synced my data in quite a while? Please contact me ASAP.
creator: igorevichnikitos5

title: Desktop PC Firefox says 'Sync now but laptop Firefox says 'Syncronize now
content: My Desktop and Laptop show two different options for Firefox sync. The Desktop says 'Sync now while my laptop says 'Synchronize now. Both are Windows 10 and same version OS and browser. Whats up with the difference here?
creator: ccraig.ns

title: can not delete the question
content: All solved but can not delete the question
creator: a785433

title: Firefox not remembering security settings.
content: Firefox (107.0) remembers passwords and logins, also ,history correctly and works fine when I check "Ask to save logins and passwords for websites" and "Remember search and form history" under Privacy and Security tab in settings page but when Firefox or computer is turned off or restarted these settings are not kept and are unchecked.When I go to settings page and recheck these items every thing works fine. How can I get Firefox to remember my settings choice, this feature has worked perfectly for a long time but has only started doing this recently. I cant remember if it started after an update or not but I don't think so.
creator: viking65

title: ui-monospace breaks monospace
content:
Rather than going to the next font in the list, ui-monospace causes text to render in a serif font. Same issue described here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1373855 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1351497

Firefox 107 on Ubuntu 22.04
creator: qshan

title: White Space Blocking Bottom of Browser
content:
Hello,

Please see the attached picture. On my laptop screen (but not my second screen monitor) when opening just Firefox, there is a considerable white bar at the bottom of the browser that blocks website content. When I click on it, it brings me to another task I have open, such as Microsoft Word or my desktop.

Chrome and Edge does not have this problem, I checked. It is relegated to Firefox only.

How can I fix this?
creator: lianalynn13

title: Refresh Button Won't Refresh
content:
Sometimes I update a page on one tab and refresh another tab with the same page to see the changes. However refreshing does not refresh the page and changes can take a few minutes to show up no matter how many times I hit refresh. This is not constant. Sometimes it works fine, other times it doesn't.

I have tried: Holding down the Shift key and left-clicking the Reload button Pressing "Ctrl + F5" or pressing "Ctrl + Shift + R" Clearing Cache and Cookies Turned off all Extensions Started Firefox in Safe Mode

I switched to Firefox from Chrome earlier this month and this problem has never happened in Chrome.

Is there anything else I can try? It's not life-ruining but it is a little annoying.

Thank you!
creator: devilsalt

title: opps massage from youtube.
content:
Hello.

I getting the opps massage from youtube other site work just fine.Youtube to me is strange in one page it is logged in on other page i logged out,and when i logged i can still comment on youtube page withe user name but i still logged out,in this event i click on the log in the opps page is what iu getting.I tried to reach youtube support trough googles page but they told me that all is fine and dandy.To them maybe.But for me it seems that youtube is dying.There is another video madia share page i looking foward to be on.

This problem to me is not broweser realetd probnlej because i tried chrome based ones like edge but same thing happend.Gmail just works fine only youtube have problem with.If anyone can help that would be awesome.
creator: Huzal

title: Firefox Color Management/Profile Not Being Used
content:
In FF 107.0 (64-bit) on Windows 11, I'm finding that FF is suddenly not honoring my color profile, so everything looks over-saturated. I've tried using gfx.color_management.mode 1 (my typical setting) and 2 (the default), and neither seems to fix the issue. The same issue exists in a fresh profile. I'd roll back to test an earlier version of FF, but it seems that's no longer easily possible. Edge is displaying colors properly.

Any ideas or known bugs?
creator: nrbelex

title: Private window: Firefox clears your search and browsing history
content: A new update of Mozilla offered me this new option. New page called: Private window: Firefox clears your search and browsing history ..." However, I opened it on the task bar and used it as my browser window and it has deleted ALL my sign in's that I leave signed in to the site. How do I get rid of this page all together? I have it on my task bar, I don't want to use it. I didn't see it in Programs in the Control panel so how do I delete this feature of Mozilla's? The window I want to delete says : "Private window: Firefox clears your search and browsing history when you close all private windows. This doesn’t make you anonymous."
creator: meandsinger2010
